target_title: Fix the portal avoidance

note.body:
Already observing some issues with the current gtk main and xdp-gnome main:

* gtk4 apps start with delay more than 15 sec after session started.
* gnome-shell screencast is unavailable, logging after timeout "Error connecting to the screencast service."

Specifying env GDK_DEBUG=no-portals for the xdg-desktop-portal-gnome.service resolves the issues.

target_title: Implement global shortcuts

note.body:
[Chromium has just merged support](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5871484) for this portal. This will roll downstream into Electron apps later down the line as apps like Slack update their Electron version. Chromium would be the biggest "toolkit" to have support for the portal so far.

It would be nice if the wonderful people working on https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/xdg-desktop-portal-gnome/-/merge_requests/166 could finish this for GNOME 48 to have day 1 support. :)

target_title: general: Port AdwMessageDialog to AdwAlertDialog

note.body:
I don't think AdwDialog can work with the GNOME portal, at least not as it is right now. GNOME portal is an entirely separate process that "attaches" dialogs to windows through the compositor. AFAIK AdwDialog cannot work with that, because it depends on the widgetry of the window, which the GNOME portal doesn't have access to.

@alicem can you clarify if it's indeed possible to use AdwDialog in this situation?

target_title: Delegated FileChooser call failed: The name is not activatable

note.body:
Thank you for the pointers. I've reached out to the maintainer of this package on Arch.

I looked in to the origin of this error message and it must come all the way back from dbus itself. I don't see that error string on `xdg-desktop-portal-gnome`, `xdg-desktop-portal-gtk`, or `xdg-desktop-portal`. Otherwise I'd open a PR for it.

I'm not too familiar with how dbus works so thank you for the quick walkthrough.

target_title: Delegated FileChooser call failed: The name is not activatable

note.body:
> nautilus was not installed. Doing so solved the problem.

You should open a bug in your distro. Nautilus is a hard dependency of xdg-desktop-portal-gnome now. So your distro's packaging shouldn't allow you to install x-d-p-gnome but uninstall Nautilus.

> A more descriptive error message here would have been helpful.

I don't see why a patch to improve the error message wouldn't be accepted.

Something like: "Delegated FileChooser Call Failed: Nautilus not found (contact your distributor)".

But I'm not a maintainer for this project

> I'm guessing "The name is not activatable" is referring to nautilus not being on PATH.

"The name is not activatable" is a standard dbus error message which means that the service you were trying to talk to A) wasn't running already and B) isn't registered to be automatically started  to handle your request. Specifically in this case, the x-d-p-g tried to talk to `org.gnome.Nautilus` and got back an error basically saying "IDK what that is, and I have nothing I can start to provide that"

target_title: Delegated FileChooser call failed: The name is not activatable

note.body:
`nautilus` was not installed. Doing so solved the problem. A more descriptive error message here would have been helpful. I'm guessing "The name is not activatable" is referring to `nautilus` not being on PATH.

Thank you.

Print dialog is broken when used by print portal

note.body:
Hi, I've tried to reproduce the issue today but with no luck. So I have some questions for you Michael.
1) What is the name of the printer you have the issue with?
2) After you open the print dialog and select the printer, what does "lp -s" shows for it? What does the "lp -s" shows for other printers?
3) Could you turn on debugging of CUPS and try to reproduce the issue?
You can do it by setting "LogLevel debug2" in "/etc/cups/cupsd.conf". You need to restart "cups" service after that. Optionally, you can redirect the debug output to a file by setting e.g. "ErrorLog /var/log/cups/error.log" in "/etc/cups/cups-files.conf" to not flood your journal with the debuginfo. This could tell us what is the cause of the client-error-bad-request error as it can be accompanied by a detailed error message.
4) Is the printer connected over (wifi and USB:) or just the USB?
5) Does the printer advertises itself over avahi (e.g. via "avahi-browse -vrat")? And if yes with what info?
